document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the subfamily Schoenobiinae (Lepidoptera: Pyraloidea: Crambidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the subfamily Schoenobiinae (Lepidoptera: Pyraloidea: Crambidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Catagela adjurella Walker, 1863
.
List Specimens Lipid. Insects Colln Br. Mus.
, 27: 191; Wang, 1980 .
Economic Insect Fauna of China
,
21: 64. Type locality: Sri Lanka
.

Description. Forewing with fuscous fasciae; small spots present at upper angle, lower angle and middle of cell; an oblique line from apex to middle of inner margin. Hindwing with a blurry fascia at postmedial area in male, without any fasciae in female. In male genitalia, valva with apex truncated; aedeagus strong, cornutus spine-like, curved

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China ( Shandong , Henan , Jiangsu , Anhui , Zhejiang , Hubei , Hunan , Guangdong , Hainan , Yunnan ); India , Sri Lanka .
